bullets.text: Netflix to acquire Warner Bros. film/streaming assets for ~$72–83B; CNN excluded. Massive media consolidation faces antitrust scrutiny.
SpaceX seeks ~$800B valuation in secondary sale, becoming America’s most valuable private company; signals strong private-market appetite for space and AI connectivity.
Treasurys logged worst weekly selloff since April, pushing yields higher and raising borrowing costs for governments, corporates, and mortgages ahead of Fed decision.
Core PCE inflation came in at 2.8% YoY (September, delayed), below expectations, bolstering disinflation narrative ahead of Fed meeting.
EU levies first DSA penalty: €120M fine on X over ‘deceptive’ verification and transparency failures, tightening platform compliance costs in Europe.
U.S. Supreme Court will review Trump’s order restricting birthright citizenship, posing major constitutional and labor-market implications for immigration policy.
CDC advisory panel dropped universal newborn hepatitis B vaccination guidance, shifting to risk-based approach that may affect coverage, hospital protocols, and public health outcomes.
Court finalized remedies in Google antitrust case, potentially reshaping default search deals and Android distribution economics across tech and advertising markets.
Meta acquires AI wearable startup Limitless, signaling push into AI hardware and on-device assistants, with implications for data capture and ecosystem lock-in.
Plunging battery costs and record deployments have strengthened grid reliability, with energy storage already surpassing 2025 targets, accelerating renewables integration.
Putin offers India “uninterrupted” fuel supplies despite U.S. pressure, underscoring deepening Russia-India energy ties and sanctions leakage risks.
Carvana to join S&P 500, capping dramatic turnaround and likely prompting index-tracking inflows and short-covering.
The New York Times sues Perplexity for copyright infringement, escalating legal risks for AI firms training on news content without licenses.
House panels advance Social Security bills proposing higher retirement age and expanded ID-theft protections, signaling potential benefit reforms and fiscal impacts.
